column4: Uncomment 'BrowseAddress @LOCAL', 'BrowsePort 631', add 'Allow From @LOCAL' to the <Location />
...one more, let me look...
Oh, yeah, and uncomment 'Port 631' and comment out 'Listen 127.0.0.1:631'
(if you haven't already, which it sounds like you have)
Then '/etc/init.d/cupsys restart'
Oh, and comment 'Browsing Off'
I can't get to a printer on an xp box .. is that what I need to do ? go in /etc/cups/cupsd.conf  and edit something?
Yep
I might try to put up a page on the wiki.
For you, the big thing will be to add 'Allow From @LOCAL' to the bottom of the <Location /> section of /etc/cups/cupsd.conf
Then '/etc/init.d/cupsys restart'
Then you can use http://yourhostname:631/printers/yourprintername from your XP box.
You'll still need drivers for your printer, or go to cups.org and download the base CUPS driver for Windows.
Say that again?  Your Windows box has the printer attached?
You need to go to your Control panel for Windows and add/remove windows components and install print services for UNIX.
Then you can tell CUPS that you're printing to an LPR printer at the Windows box's IP.
Then you should be set.
You may have had it using an SMB share, which I think Mandrake does easily.  Not sure about Ubuntu.
Computer -> System Configuration -> Printing -> Add Printer.  You'll see the option for a Windows printer right there.
You should be set.
Check the event log on your Windows box.
